solution_line_template: First find the total number of zits in Mr. Jones' class: {jones_avg_zits} zits/kid * {jones_num_kids} kids = <<{jones_avg_zits}*{jones_num_kids}={jones_total_zits}>>{jones_total_zits} zits

Then find the total number of zits in Ms. Swanson's class: {swanson_avg_zits} zits/kid * {swanson_num_kids} kids = <<{swanson_avg_zits}*{swanson_num_kids}={swanson_total_zits}>>{swanson_total_zits} zits

Then subtract the number of zits in Ms. Swanson's class from the number in Mr. Jones' class to find the difference: {jones_total_zits} zits - {swanson_total_zits} zits = <<{jones_total_zits}-{swanson_total_zits}={difference}>>{difference} zits
